name: stops everything
content:
Sprite stops doing all its behaviors.

If a sprite has multiple behaviors, they can all be stopped at once using this block.  For more information see [`Adding and Removing Behaviors`(#89eba4)](/docs/spritelab/spritelab_adding-and-removing-behaviors/).

examples.description: The sprite has three behaviors: spinning, swimming, and growing. When it is clicked, all three behaviors will stop.

palette_params.name: sprite
palette_params.description: The sprite or sprite group, whose behaviors are being stopped

tips:
- Connect this block to events like [`sprite clicked`(#62fc94)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_spriteClicked/). Code is executed quickly in Sprite Lab. If you tell a sprite to begin a behavior and then tell it to stop in the same sequence of code, there is not enough time to see the behavior in action.
- This block can be used along with [`set sprite property`(#5ef3ff)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_setProp/), [`jump to`(#5ef3ff)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_jumpTo/) and [`change color`(#5ef3ff)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_setTint/) to restore a sprite to its initial state, which can be useful in games and simulations that can be “reset”.
